item.title: The Last Moment That Matters
item.description: Tech layoffs are accelerating, Microsoft says full automation is 18 months away, and a former Google ethicist warns of a jobs collapse by 2027. The question isn’t whether AI will change everything. It’s whether we’ll prepare for what comes after.

item.title: Eighteen Months to What, Exactly?
item.description: Microsoft’s AI chief says white-collar work will be automated in 18 months. Economists see jobless growth. Workers are already pivoting. The real question isn’t whether the grind disappears. It’s what replaces it.

item.title: How Agents Break the Procrastination Loop
item.description: Procrastination isn’t laziness. It’s task aversion, driven by the friction between knowing what you want and actually starting. Agentic AI collapses that friction, and what’s left is the work you actually want to do.
